meanings.sent1: The puppy was naughtier than the kitten.
meanings.sent2: The children were getting naughtier as bedtime approached.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was even naughtier when it found a stash of acorns.
meanings.sent4: Her mischievous grin grew naughtier as she plotted her next prank.
meanings.sent5: The naughty puppy's behavior became naughtier with each passing day.

meanings.definition: Of little or no value; worthless
meanings.sent1: The broken toy was even naughtier after it fell apart.
meanings.sent2: The old book had become naughtier over time, with its pages falling out.
meanings.sent3: The rusty old bike was naughtier than the shiny new one.
meanings.sent4: The faded painting looked even naughtier under the dim light.
meanings.sent5: The worn-out shoes were naughtier than they appeared at first glance.
